greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T read by rows: T(i,0)=1 for i >= 0; T(i,i)=0 for i=0,1,2,3; T(i,i)=0 for i >= 4; T(i,j) = T(i-1,j) + T(i-2,j-1) for 1<=j<=i-1.
comment: T(i+j,j) is the number of strings (s(1),...,s(i+1)) of nonnegative integers s(k) such that 0<=s(k)-s(k-1)<=1 for k=2,3,...,i+1 and s(i+1)=j.
T(i+j,j) is the number of compositions of j consisting of i parts, all of in {0,1}.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
C. Kimberling, Path-counting and Fibonacci numbers, Fib. Quart. 40 (4) (2002) 328-338, Example 1B.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 25 2020
program: for(n=0,12, for(k=0,n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 25 2020
elif k eq n and n lt 4 then return 1;
elif k eq n then return 0;
end if; return T; end function;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 25 2020
else: return T(n-1, k) + T(n-2, k-1)
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 25 2020
elif k=n and n<4 then return 1;
Flat(List([0..12], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 25 2020
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 28 2000
